results.title: Customer service
results.brief_description: The aim of this program is to present knowledge and techniques required to develop and maintain on-going service to customers and to convert complaints into appointments to further strengthen customer ties. A manual which complements this program may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Curious George rides a bike
results.brief_description: Based on the story by H.A. Rey with his illustrations, this animated film tells of the droll adventures, pranks and triumphs of a monkey called George when he is given a push bike for a present.

results.title: Curious George
results.brief_description: The mischievous exploits of Curious George the monkey in a delightful puppet animation adapted from the book of the same title by H.A. Rey. George is brought from the wilds of the jungle to the sophistication of the city and experiences a few mishaps along the way.

results.title: Cup final [1961]
results.brief_description: Sporting documentary on the 1961 FA Cup final of Tottenham Hotspurs versus Leicester City at Wembley Stadium. Historical in the sense that Spurs won 2-0 and became the first team in the history of English football to win both the League and Cup double.

results.title: Cultural conflict
results.creator_credit: David Zweck and Country Education Project
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English for H.S.C. students”.
A program of interviews and discussions led by Peter Couchman. The texts “Mister Johnson” (Joyce Carey), “The Inheritors” (William Golding), “A Place Apart” (Dervla Murphy) and “The Immigrants” (Wendy Lowenstein and Morag Loh) are considered in examining the causes of cultural conflict, how people are affected by it, how conflict can both enrich and impoverish individuals and communities and how conflict is resolved. Also appearing are Dr. M. McLaughlin and Charles D’Aprano.

results.title: Cults: choice or coercion
results.brief_description: Explores the legal, moral and emotional questions raised by contemporary cults. A young man who was indoctrinated into the Unification Church (Moonies) explains inside workings of the cult, and their parents give an account of the intervention and “deprogramming” of their son. Supplemented by interviews with Dr. Margaret Singer, who has done extensive research on cults and mind control.
